}} 'Smith International' was a Fortune 500 company headquartered in the
Greenspoint district and in unincorporated Harris County, Texas. "[http://www.smith.com/$0abbd12c-22aa-4005-86ab-
b763cea0163b Welcome to SMITH]." Smith International. Retrieved on December 8,
2009. "[http://www.greenspoint.org/ExportedSite/About_US/BoundaryMap.htm
Boundary Map]." Greenspoint Management District. Retrieved on May 19,
2009. Smith International ceased to exist as an independent company
following the merger with Schlumberger. This company supplies products to gas
and oil production and exploration companies. The company used to be easily
identified by its red 'Sii' logo. The company had recently changed its logo to
consist of the word "SMITH" in black capital letters with a green globe.

A February 21, 2010 announcement said Schlumberger would acquire the company in
an all stock deal valued at $11.3 billion. The sale price is 45.84-a-share price
was 37.5 percent higher than Smith's closing price on February 18, 2010. The
deal is the biggest acquisition in Schlumberger history. [http://www.businessweek.com/news/2010-02-21/schlumberger-to-buy-
smith-for-about-11-3-billion-correct-.html Schlumberger to Buy Smith for About
$11.3 Billion - businessweek.com - February 21, 2010]

The merger received unconditional approval from the US Department of Justice on
July 27, 2010. http://www.slb.com/news/press_releases/2010/2010_0727_smith_-
doj_approval.aspx Subsequently, the merger with Schlumberger was completed
on August 27, 2010. http://www.slb.com/news/press_releases/2010/2010_0827_s-
mith_merger_closes.aspx
